summary:
I’m a communication strategist with creative zest, passionate about women’s economic advancement in a development context. I joined 100WEEKS in their Marketing, Communication and Fundraising team. My personal mission is to grow and diversify the individual donor base of 100WEEKS (with a focus on middle-major donors) and to deepen the engagement throughout the donor journey. 

Fundraising might sound, to some people, like a surprising turn in my career trajectory. Yet, it presents the perfect opportunity to tie together my most valuable skills in communication and management consulting. Communicating with impact and strategic intent to drive the growth of the 100WEEKS private donor base, supported by a digital journey that underpins both a unique experience for donors and a data-driven approach to deliver insights.

100WEEKS is an innovative direct cash giving international NGO addressing extreme poverty in rural communities in Rwanda, Ghana, Uganda and Ivory Coast. They invest in women's entrepreneurship to lift whole communities out of entrenched poverty. By giving unconditional cash directly to selected groups of women for 100 weeks, providing them with training and access to a saving and loan fund.

profile_positions.description:
Growing the individual giving donor base for 100WEEKS through effective marketing campaigns and a communication strategy that creates connection. Inspiring individuals to support women’s entrepreneurship to eradicate poverty in rural communities in Rwanda, Ghana, Uganda and Ivory Coast.

Watch the video below to learn more and follow the 100WEEKS company page!
profile_positions.title: Lead Fundraising for Individual Donors

profile_positions.description:
Strategic Planning & Communication advisor for the Women’s Access to Justice programme, a 5-year regional programme by UN Women’s Regional Office in Asia and the Pacific. My impact: 

- Development of a unified programme identity to bring the value of the joint-programming with the partners more to the forefront
- Delivered a cohesive communication framework to align the narrative and core messages across thematic areas, country offices and partner organizations. 
- Developed a communication infrastructure (channels, voice and platforms) from the ground up to raise awareness about the programme activities as well as to educate the general public about Women’s Access to Justice 
- Strengthened regional communication efforts to improve consistency in the positioning and visibility of the programme through campaigns and content 
- Strengthened donor engagement through the development of communication assets, donor presentations and proposals

A catalyst to land the UN Women consultancy contract (November 2020), and what spearheaded my career transition from the private sector to the international development sector, was my 2019/2020 post-graduate studies at the University of Edinburgh.
profile_positions.title: International Consultant | United Nations

profile_positions.description:
Regional communication specialist for Deloitte’s Centre of Excellence for the Future of Work, a Deloitte global flagship center. 

-	Working with the director of the Centre of Excellence on internal stakeholder engagement, to raise awareness and create buy-in across offices in the Southeast Asia region 
-	Lead role in communication assets development, working with a multidisciplinary team of UX designers, graphic designers and programmers, to deliver a package of digital tools for internal and external communication purposes 
-	Supported efforts to position the Centre of Excellence activities in relation to the established consulting portfolio focusing on Human Capital services.
-	Development of keynote presentations to increase awareness and understanding about the Future of Work key concepts, trends and challenges
profile_positions.title: Communication specialist (Future of Work Centre of Excellence)

profile_positions.description:
Independent management consultant focusing on organizational development, positioning, service proposition and execution of strategic initiatives for medium sized businesses. Projects:

-	Reviewed and proposed a repositioning of the programme portfolio, leading to more consistency in the regional approach to service offerings (the Bonsey Design Partnership, Singapore)
-	Designed and led execution of a multi-workstream strategic initiative (Atlantis Healthcare Group, UK)
-	Created rigor around the service methodology and clarity to articulate the niche positioning of the service portfolio (LH Alliances, UK)

During this time I was also selected to and completed the NUS’ (National University Singapore) technology commercialisation accelerator programme 2016, working on my early stage prototype of a mobile technology to support families dealing with remote senior caregiving.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant | Organizational Development & Positioning

profile_positions.description:
Private sector client-facing advisory service role. I left as a Senior Consultant, managing small teams and working with director level stakeholders in typically a complex matrix (and international) stakeholder landscape.

-	Areas of technical expertise: strategic communication, change management; training in the context of technology adoption; programme planning; project communication planning and execution; internal communication and stakeholder engagement
-	Type of projects: Human Capital projects e.g. organisational development, HR function transformation, global change management projects, technology adoption
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description: Client-facing junior management consultant focusing on organisational development, gaining foundational skills in change management and communication strategy and execution. After 2,5 years initiated a transfer to join Deloitte's consulting group in London. I've worked on major projects across industries including: Telecommunications; Public Sector (Ministry Department); Professional Services; Pharmaceutical.
profile_positions.title: Consultant
